required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Post Marketing Surveillance Study To Observe Safety And Efficacy Of Aromasin In The Patients With Early Or Advanced Breast Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: Post Marketing Surveillance Study To Observe Safety And Efficacy Of Aromasin In The Patients With Early Or Advanced Breast Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: This non-interventional study is to monitor use in real practice in Korea including adverse events on Aromasin (Exemestane).

detailed_description.textblock: All cases at the participating institutions.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events (TEAEs)
primary_outcome.time_frame: From the first dose of Aromasin through the end of the study for an average of 5.6 months
primary_outcome.description: All AEs reported after start of administration of Aromasin were considered as TEAEs and summarized.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Without Recurrence/Metastasis (Early Breast Cancer)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the end of the study, average of 5.6 months.
secondary_outcome.description: The antitumor efficacy for early breast cancer was measured by recurrence/metastasis status (Yes or No) of the participant at the end of the study. The investigator recorded the final evaluation date and the information of tumor recurrence or metastasis (Yes or No) in each participant's case report form (CRF).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the end of the study, average of 5.6 months
secondary_outcome.description: Time-to-Progression was defined as the duration from the date of first administration of Aromasin to the date of recurrence or contralateral breast cancer.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants by Overall Tumor Response Assessed Using Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST) (Advanced Breast Cancer)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the end of the study, average of 5.6 months
secondary_outcome.description: The antitumor efficacy for advanced breast cancer was measured by objective tumor assessments according to the RECIST of uni-dimensional evaluation. Complete response (CR) was defined as disappearance of all target and non-target lesions, and no new lesions. Partial response (PR) was defined as disappearance of all target lesions, a persistence of ≥1 non-target lesions, no new lesions; or a ≥30% decrease in the sum of the longest dimensions of the target lesions, no unequivocal progression of existing non-target lesions, no new lesions. Stable disease (SD) was defined as neither sufficient shrinkage to qualify for PR nor sufficient increase to qualify for progressive disease (PD), no unequivocal progression of existing non-target lesions, and no new lesions. PD was defined as a ≥20% increase in the sum of the longest dimensions of the target lesions; or unequivocal progression of existing non-target lesions, or the appearance of ≥1 new lesions.

arm_group.description: adjuvant setting after two to three years of tamoxifen
palliative setting after progression of disease with anti-estrogen therapy

study_pop.textblock: - Postmenopausal women diagnosed as estrogen-receptor positive early breast cancer, who have received two to three years of tamoxifen and are switched to AROMASIN for completion of a total of five consecutive years of adjuvant hormonal therapy OR postmenopausal women with breast cancer that has progressed following anti-estrogen therapy.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- - Postmenopausal women with breast cancer eligible for hormonal therapy.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant breast-feeding premenopausal.

facility.name: Soon Chun Hyang University Hospital Cheonan
Soon Chun Hyang University Bucheon Hospital
Myongji Hospital, Kwangdong Unversity College of Medicine
Wonkwang University School of Medicine and Hospital (WUH)
Cheil General Hospital & Women's Healthcare Center
Severance Hospital, Yonsei University Health System, Yonsei Cancer Center
Asan Medical Center, University of Ulsan
Korea University Medical Center (KUMC) - Korea University Guro Hospital

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Participants were enrolled between June 2010 and June 2014 from 25 Korean health care centers.

group.title: Aromasin
group.description: Participants were included if they had early breast cancer for adjuvant hormonal therapy or advanced breast cancer for second-line hormonal therapy after anti-estrogen therapy and were prescribed Aromasin for the first time. Aromasin was administered as part of routine care. The use and dosage recommendations for aromasin were based on the approved local product document. Any adjustments were made solely according to medical and therapeutic necessity.

participants_list.participants: At least one safety assessment (Safety Population)

group.title: Aromasin
group.description: Participants were included if they had early breast cancer for adjuvant hormonal therapy or advanced breast cancer for second-line hormonal therapy after anti-estrogen therapy and were prescribed Aromasin for the first time. Aromasin was administered as part of routine care. The use and dosage recommendations for Aromasin were based on the approved local product document. class.title: Adjuvant Therapy for Early Breast Cancer

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events (TEAEs)
outcome.description: All AEs reported after start of administration of Aromasin were considered as TEAEs and summarized.
outcome.time_frame: From the first dose of Aromasin through the end of the study for an average of 5.6 months
outcome.population: Safety Analysis Set: included participants who received Aromasin at least once and were evaluated upon its related safety endpoints at least once.

group.title: Aromasin
group.description: Participants were included if they had early breast cancer for adjuvant hormonal therapy or advanced breast cancer for second-line hormonal therapy after anti-estrogen therapy and were prescribed Aromasin for the first time. Aromasin was administered as part of routine care. The use and dosage recommendations for aromasin were based on the approved local product document. Any adjustments were made solely according to medical and therapeutic necessity.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events (TEAEs)
measure.description: All AEs reported after start of administration of Aromasin were considered as TEAEs and summarized.
measure.population: Safety Analysis Set: included participants who received Aromasin at least once and were evaluated upon its related safety endpoints at least once.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants Without Recurrence/Metastasis (Early Breast Cancer)
outcome.description: The antitumor efficacy for early breast cancer was measured by recurrence/metastasis status (Yes or No) of the participant at the end of the study. The investigator recorded the final evaluation date and the information of tumor recurrence or metastasis (Yes or No) in each participant’s case report form (CRF).
outcome.time_frame: At the end of the study, average of 5.6 months.
outcome.population: Efficacy Analysis Set: included all participants who received Aromasin for at least 4 weeks in treatment of breast cancer and had efficacy data available.

group.title: Aromasin
group.description: Participants were included if they had early breast cancer for adjuvant hormonal therapy or advanced breast cancer for second-line hormonal therapy after anti-estrogen therapy and were prescribed Aromasin for the first time. Aromasin was administered as part of routine care. The use and dosage recommendations for aromasin were based on the approved local product document. Any adjustments were made solely according to medical and therapeutic necessity.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants Without Recurrence/Metastasis (Early Breast Cancer)
measure.description: The antitumor efficacy for early breast cancer was measured by recurrence/metastasis status (Yes or No) of the participant at the end of the study. The investigator recorded the final evaluation date and the information of tumor recurrence or metastasis (Yes or No) in each participant’s case report form (CRF).
measure.population: Efficacy Analysis Set: included all participants who received Aromasin for at least 4 weeks in treatment of breast cancer and had efficacy data available.

outcome.title: Time-to-Progression (Early Breast Cancer)
outcome.description: Time-to-Progression was defined as the duration from the date of first administration of Aromasin to the date of recurrence or contralateral breast cancer.
outcome.time_frame: At the end of the study, average of 5.6 months
outcome.population: This outcome was planned to be analyzed in participants with early breast cancer in the efficacy analysis set. However, the analysis was not performed because the data of time-to-progression was not captured in the CRF.

group.title: Aromasin
group.description: Participants were included if they had early breast cancer for adjuvant hormonal therapy or advanced breast cancer for second-line hormonal therapy after anti-estrogen therapy and were prescribed Aromasin for the first time. Aromasin was administered as part of routine care. The use and dosage recommendations for Aromasin were based on the approved local product document. Any adjustments were made solely according to medical and therapeutic necessity.

measure.title: Time-to-Progression (Early Breast Cancer)
measure.description: Time-to-Progression was defined as the duration from the date of first administration of Aromasin to the date of recurrence or contralateral breast cancer.
measure.population: This outcome was planned to be analyzed in participants with early breast cancer in the efficacy analysis set. However, the analysis was not performed because the data of time-to-progression was not captured in the CRF.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants by Overall Tumor Response Assessed Using Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST) (Advanced Breast Cancer)
outcome.description: The antitumor efficacy for advanced breast cancer was measured by objective tumor assessments according to the RECIST of uni-dimensional evaluation. Complete response (CR) was defined as disappearance of all target and non-target lesions, and no new lesions. Partial response (PR) was defined as disappearance of all target lesions, a persistence of ≥1 non-target lesions, no new lesions; or a ≥30% decrease in the sum of the longest dimensions of the target lesions, no unequivocal progression of existing non-target lesions, no new lesions. Stable disease (SD) was defined as neither sufficient shrinkage to qualify for PR nor sufficient increase to qualify for progressive disease (PD), no unequivocal progression of existing non-target lesions, and no new lesions. PD was defined as a ≥20% increase in the sum of the longest dimensions of the target lesions; or unequivocal progression of existing non-target lesions, or the appearance of ≥1 new lesions.
outcome.time_frame: At the end of the study, average of 5.6 months

group.description: Participants were included if they had early breast cancer for adjuvant hormonal therapy or advanced breast cancer for second-line hormonal therapy after anti-estrogen therapy and were prescribed Aromasin for the first time. Aromasin was administered as part of routine care. The use and dosage recommendations for Aromasin were based on the approved local product document. Any adjustments were made solely according to medical and therapeutic necessity.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants by Overall Tumor Response Assessed Using Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST) (Advanced Breast Cancer)
measure.description: The antitumor efficacy for advanced breast cancer was measured by objective tumor assessments according to the RECIST of uni-dimensional evaluation. Complete response (CR) was defined as disappearance of all target and non-target lesions, and no new lesions. Partial response (PR) was defined as disappearance of all target lesions, a persistence of ≥1 non-target lesions, no new lesions; or a ≥30% decrease in the sum of the longest dimensions of the target lesions, no unequivocal progression of existing non-target lesions, no new lesions. Stable disease (SD) was defined as neither sufficient shrinkage to qualify for PR nor sufficient increase to qualify for progressive disease (PD), no unequivocal progression of existing non-target lesions, and no new lesions. PD was defined as a ≥20% increase in the sum of the longest dimensions of the target lesions; or unequivocal progression of existing non-target lesions, or the appearance of ≥1 new lesions.

reported_events.time_frame: From first dose of Aromasin through the end of the study for an average of 5.6 months.
reported_events.desc: The same event may appear as both an adverse event and a serious adverse event. However, what is presented are distinct events. An event may be categorized as serious in 1 participant and as nonserious in another participant, or 1 participant may have experienced both a serious and nonserious event during the study.

group.title: Aromasin
group.description: Participants were included if they had early breast cancer for adjuvant hormonal therapy or advanced breast cancer for second-line hormonal therapy after anti-estrogen therapy and were prescribed Aromasin for the first time. Aromasin was administered as part of routine care. The use and dosage recommendations for Aromasin were based on the approved local product document. Any adjustments were made solely according to medical and therapeutic necessity.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
